Content.text:
Aajanubahum Aravindha Nethram
 Athmabhi Ramam Manasa Smarami (2)
 Bhoolokha Vaikunta Parthi Nivasam
 Prabhu Sai Ramam Manasa Smarami (2)
 
 I invoke in my mind, the long-armed, lotus-eyed, indweller, Rama,
 who resides in Vaikunta (abode of the Gods). He is also
 Lord Sai, residing in Puttaparthi.

Ao Ao Sai Natha
 Ao Ao He Jagannatha 
 Ao Ao Sai Natha
 Darshan Ke Liye Taras Rahe Hai
 Nayan Hamare O Sai
 Darsha Dikhao Daya Ke Sagar
 Ao Shankar He Parameshvar
 [Ao Ao Sai Natha (3)]
 
 Please come, Sai, Lord of the Universe, our eyes are eager to see Your divine form. O Lord Shankara, the ocean of compassion, grant us Your vision.

Aao Aao Sai Pyare
 Kirtan Karü Maï Sai Thumhare
 Aao Aao Sai Pyare
 Thum Ho Mere Nayanö Ke Tare
 Darshan Do Jivan Ke Sahare (2)
 
 Please come, beloved Sai, let me sing your glory.
 O Supreme Lord, You are the support of my life and the
 shining star of my eyes.

Aao Gopala Giridhari
 Aao Aao Antharyami
 Aao Aao Anandha Sai
 Aao Gopala Giridhari
 Aao Aao Atmanivasi
 Aao Aao Shanthi Nivasi
 
 Come, O Gopala! You held up the mountain Govardhana
 to save Your devotees. We welcome You the indweller of our
 hearts. Lord Sai, You reside in the abode of peace and grant bliss.

Aao Pyare Nayan Hamare Sai Hamare Aao
 Thum Bin Koi Nahi Rakhvale
 Thum Bin Kaun Sahare (Baba) (2)
 Aao Sai Pyare
 Sai Hamare Aao (3)
 
 Please come our beloved Lord Sai! You are as precious
 as our eyes. Without You, there is no one to
 protect us. Who but You can support us, O Beloved Sai?

Akhanda Jyothi Jalao Sai Man Mandir Me
 Akhanda Jyothi Jalao (2)
 Koti Surya Sama Theja Swaroopa
 Sai Thum Ho Divya Swaroopa
 Akhanda Jyothi Jalao (2)
 Divya Jyothi Gnana Jyothi Prema Jyothi Jalao
 
 Sai, light the eternal flame within the temple of my heart
 and illumine my intelligence. Embodiment of love and divinity,
 with the effulgence equal to that of million suns,
 light in me the flame of divinity, knowledge and love.

Akhila Jagath Ke Dhatha Sai
 Shirdi Nivasi Bhagwan
 Darshan Do Bhagwan (Sai)
 Kalimala Bhanjana Parama Dayaghana
 Karuna Nidhe Shirdi Vasa
 Karuna Nidhe Parthi Vasa
 Dina Janavana Parthi Mahesha
 Shirdi Nivasi Bhagwan
 Darshan Do Bhagwan (Sai)
 
 O Lord Sai of Shirdi and Parthi, creator of the cosmos,
 supremely merciful, You are the destroyer of the evils
 of the Kali age and the friend of the downtrodden.
 Kindly grant the vision of Your form

Akhilandeshwari Raja Rajeshwari
 Dhaya Sagari Parama Krupakari
 Samba Vinodhini Shiva Sai Shankari
 Mangala Gauri Matha Maheshwari
 Samba Vinodhini Shiva Sai Shankari
 
 Supremely Divine, the Goddess of the whole Universe, the
 ocean of compassion, is Sai Shankari. She is the delight of
 Shiva, and the divine mother who grants auspiciousness.

Alakh Niranjana Bhava Bhaya Bhanjana Narayan Narayan
 Narayan Narayan Narayan Sai Narayan
 Narayan Narayan Narayan Sathya Narayan
 
 Lord Narayana (Lord Sai) is the imperceptible,
 faultless destroyer of the cycle of birth and death.

Allah Bhajo Maula Bhajo He Allah Sai Bhagavan
 Ram Bhajo He Krishna Bhajo He Rama Krishna Bhagavan
 Nanak Bhajo Gautama Bhajo He Buddha Sai Bhagavan
 Yeshu Bhajo Zoarastra Bhajo He Mahavir Bhagavan
 Sai Bhajo Shirdi Sai Bhajo He Shirdi Sai Bhagavan
 Satya Bhajo Satya Sai Bhajo He Satya Sai Bhagavan
 
 Repeat the different names of God: Allah, Rama, Krishna, Nanak,
 Gautam Buddha, Jesus, Zoroaster, Mahavir, Shirdi Sai and Satya Sai.

Allah Nama Bhajo Bhajore Bhajo Maula Nama Bhajo Bhajore Bhajo
 Nanak Yeshu Mahavir Nama Bhajo
 Shri Buddha Deva Bhajo Bhajore Bhajo Shirdi Sai . . .
 . . . . Baba Bhajo Bhajore Bhajo
 Shri Raghu Rama Bhajo Govinda Kr'shna Bhajo
 Shri Sathya Sai Bhajo Bhajore Bhajo
 
 Recite the names of Allah, Nanak, Jesus, Mahavir, and Buddha. 
 Worship Lord Shirdi Sai, Rama (ofRaghu dynasty),
 Govinda, Krishna, and Sathya Sai.e.

Allah Thum Ho Ishwar Thum Ho 
 Thumhi Ho Ram Rahim Thumhi Ho Ram Rahim
 Yeshu Thum Ho Nanak Thum Ho
 Zorastra Bhi Ho Mahavir Thum Ho
 Gauthama Buddha Karim Gauthama Buddha Karim
 Mere Ram Mere Ram Ram Rahim (3)
 
 O Lord! You are known by many names: Allah, Ishwara, Ram,
 Rahim, Jesus, Guru Nanak, Zoroaster, Mahavir,
 Karim and Krishna

Allah Yesu Buddha Deva Antaru Neevae
 Moula Sai Mahavira Nanaku Neevae
 Rama Krishna Shiva Rupa Dhaariyu Neevae
 Vedha Gita Grantha Mula Saramu Neevae
 Madhamulanni Poojinchu Daivamu Neevae
 Sarva Dharma Priya Satya Sai Neevae
 Sairam Sairam Sairam Satya Sairam (2)
 
 O Sairam! You are Allah, Jesus, Buddha, Mahavira and Guru Nanak. 
 You took the forms of Rama, Krishna and Shiva. You are the essence of the
 Vedas, the Gita and the Granth Saheb (Sacred Book of the Sikhs). You are the
 One Lord worshipped by all the religions. You are Sathya Sai who loves all
 religions. We chant your name.

Amba Bhavani Shiva Shambhu Kumara
 Shri Gana Natha Shantakara
 Purana Purusha Satya Sai Natha
 Pranava Swaroopa Parthisha
 
 The Lord of the divine forces is the beloved son of Shiva
 and Mother Parvathi, and the giver of peace.
 Lord Sathya Sai of Parthi, is the eternal being and
 embodiment of Aum.

Amba Mandahasa Vadhani Manohari Sai Jagath Janani
 Matha Matha Matha Jagath Janani (Amba Mandahasa...)
 Jagath Janani Shubha Karini
 Sai Jaganmatha Sathya Sai Jaganmatha (Amba)
 
 Sai is the charming, gently-smiling Mother who has created this Universe.
 She bestows auspiciousness.

Amba Parameshwari Akhilandeshwari
 Adi Parashakti Palaya Mam
 Shri Bhuvaneshwari Raja Rajeshwari
 Ananda Rupini Palaya Mam
 
 Supreme Goddess of the entire creation, the divine energy 
 is the Goddess of the three worlds. The
 sovereign ruler, whose very nature is bliss, is our protector.

Amba Sahita Samba Sadashiva
 Hara Hara Hara Hara Mahadeva
 Hara Hara Hara Hara Mahadeva
 Parvati Ramana Sadashiva
 Hara Hara Hara Hara Mahadeva
 
 Praise Lord Shiva, who is accompanied by Amba (Parvati).
 Praise the Lord of Lords, the destroyer of evil.

Ambe Janani Abhirami 
 Abhaya Pradayini Shivakami 
 Ambe Janani Abhirami 
 Shambavi Shankari Sarveshwari 
 Shanta Swarupini Shiva Shankari 
 Sathya Swarupini Sai Matha 
 Sashwatha Ananda Dhayini Matha 
 
 Mother Parvathi, creator and protector, is the graceful mother of all. 
 Mother Sai is the embodiment of Truth and Peace 
 and the grantor of Eternal Bliss

Ambika Thanaya Gajanana
 Gaja Vadana Gana Natha Gajanana
 Pahi Ganesha Vinayaka (2)
 Thribhuvana Palaka Mangala Dhayaka
 Vidhya Buddhi Siddhi Pradhayaka
 Pahi Ganesha Vinayaka (3)
 
 Elephant-faced Lord Ganesha, son of Amba, is the Lord
 of all divine forces. Surrender to the Lord of all three
 worlds, the bestower of auspiciousness who grants
 knowledge, wisdom and intellect.

Ananda Maya Bhagwan Hey Prema Maya Bhagwan
 O Bhaghwan Sai Bhagwan
 Ananda Maya Bhagwan Hey Prema Maya Bhagwan
 He Karuna Nidhe Prabhu Sai Ram
 Kripa Nidhe Dinö Ke Pran
 Aao Prabhu Mujhe Charana Lagalo
 Daya Karo Bhagwan
 Mujhe Kripa Karo Bhagwan
 
 Lord Sai, who is full of bliss and love, is the ocean of compassion
 and grace, the very life of the downtrodden. Take me, O Lord,
 keep me at Your feet, and shower Your grace and mercy on me.

Ananda Ram Ananda Shyam
 Narayana Hari Narayana 
 Narayana Sai Narayana (2)
 Prema Svarupa Brahmananda
 Satchidananda Hari Narayana
 Narayana Hari Narayana (2)
 Narayana Sai Narayana (2)
 
 The names of Rama, Krishna and Sai (Narayana) 
 embody love, truth, knowledge, divine bliss, and
 invoke joy.

Ananda Sagara Murlidhara 
 Meera Prabhu Radhe Shyam Venugopala 
 Nanda Yashodha Ananda Kishora 
 Jai Jai Gokula Bala Jai Sai Gopala 
 
 Glory to Lord Krishna, Lord of Meera and Radha, 
 who plays melodies on the flute. He is the cowherd 
 son of Nanda and Yashoda, from Gokula

Anandam Anandam Sai Namam
 Anandam Anandam Sai Geetham
 Anandam Anandam Sai Dhyanam
 Anandam Anandam Sai Rupam
 Anandam Anandam Sai Namam (2)
 Sai Ramam Sai Geetham
 Sai Dhyanam Sai Rupam
 Sai Namam Sai Namam (3)
 
 Chanting the Name of Sai, listening to His music, meditating on His name
 looking at His form gives us bliss and happiness.

Anandame Sai Namame
 Adbhuthame Sai Geethame
 Akhandame Jyothirmayame
 Sundarame Sai Roopame (Athi)
 
 Blissful is Sai's name and transcendental are Sai Bhajans.
 Eternal is His effulgence and exceedingly beautiful is His form.

Anatha Bandho Sai Prabho
 Aparadha Kshama Karo Sai Prabho
 Jiva Yatra Me Sath Raho
 Prem Bhakti Hamko Dijo
 Hrudaya Mandhir Se Math Jao
 Charanamrutha Seva Dijo Prabho
 
 Lord Sai, kinsman of the destitute, please forgive our erring ways. 
 Accompany us in our life's journey and allow love and devotion to be born within us. 
 Do not desert the temple of our hearts. Let us serve at Your immortal feet.

Anjaneya Vira Hanumantha Shura
 Vayu Kumara Vanara Vira
 Anjaneya Vira Hanumantha Shura
 Vayu Kumara Vanara Vira
 Shri Ram Jaya Ram Jaya Jaya Ram Ram (3)
 Shri Ram Jaya Ram Jaya Sai Ram Ram
 
 The mighty, and powerful Anjaneya is the offspring of
 the Wind God. Glory be unto Lord Rama and Lord Sai.

Antar Jyothi Jalao Sai
 Brahma Sanatani Daya Karo
 Daya Karo He Poorna Jyothirmayi
 Shiva Shakthi Mayi Krupa Karo
 Deena Dayamayi Pathitha Pavani
 Sai Jagat Janani Daya Karo
 Sai Jagat Janani Krupa Karo
 
 O Sai, light the inner flame of my heart. O effulgent Lord,
 embodiment of Brahma, please have mercy on us.
 Shower Your grace, O embodiment of divine energy, and
 mother of the Universe. You are the salvation of the
 poor and helpless.

Antaranga Sai Anatha Natha Sai
 Dina Bandhu Sai Karuna Sindhu Sai
 Antaranga Sai Anatha Natha Sai
 Rama Krishna Shiva Shakthi Prema Rupa Sai
 Yuga Avathara Baba Shri Sathya Sai
 
 Sai, the indweller, Lord of the destitute, is the friend and
 kinsman of the downtrodden. He is all merciful Rama,
 Krishna, Shiva, Shakthi (Mother Goddess), and personification
 of love. He is the incarnation of the (kali) age.

Anupama Sundara Nanda Kishora
 Brindavana Ghana Shyam
 Murali Madhava Radhe Govindha
 Madhusudhana Ghana Shyam Sathya Sai Sundara Shyam
 Kunja Vihari Mandara Giridhari
 Kamala Nayana Bhagwan
 Bhaktö Ke Prabhu Parthishwara Sai
 Natavara Sundara Shyam Sathya Sai Sundara Shyam
 
 The ever beautiful son of Nanda, is the flute-playing Krishna.
 He walked the gardens of Brindavan and lifted the Mandara
 mountain to protect His devotees. The lotus-eyed Lord Krishna,
 the charming dancer is Lord Sai of Parthi.

Araja Suno Mere Parama Kripalu
 Partishvara Sai Deva 
 Araja Suno Mere Parama Kripalu
 Satya Sanatana Antaryami
 Sakala Charachara Tum Ho Swami
 Janama Marana Se Par Karo
 Bhava Bandhan Se Uddhar Karo (Baba...)
 
 Hear my request, all-merciful Parthi Sai. You are the eternal Truth, 
 the indweller and the Lord of all creation.
 Please liberate me from this bondage of existence and 
 take me beyond the process of life and death..

Aravinda Lochana Arta Janavana
 Sai Narayana Satyanarayana
 Aravinda Lochana Arta Janavana
 Ishvaramba Nandana Dosha Nivarana
 Parama Niranjana He Shubhanana
 
 The lotus-eyed Lord Sai (Narayana) protects the helpless.
 He is the son of Easvaramma and He removes sins.
 He is the immaculate Lord, who bestows auspiciousness.

At Your Feet Dear Lord We pray 
 Bless Us With Your Love This Day
 Sai Baba, Sai Baba, You Are Krishna, You Are Rama
 Oh Baba, Oh Baba, You Are Mother, You Are Father
 All Names, Every Form, All That Was And Will Be Born 
 (You are) All Names, Every Form, All That Is Forever More 
 
 (Self - explanatory)

Atmalingam Bhajore Ati Adbhutha Lingam Bhajore
 Naga Lingam Navamani Lingam 
 Nabhi Kamala Udhbhava Lingam
 Ishvara Lingam Bhajore Partishvara Lingam Bhajore
 Ishvara Lingam Bhajore Saishvara Lingam Bhajore
 
 Sing in praise of the wonderful lingam 
 that has emerged from within the navel of Sai.
 It is adorned with nine precious gems and the hood of a cobra.
 Sing in praise of the lingam that verily represents Lord Sai.

Atma Rama Ananda Ramana
 Achyutha Keshava Hari Narayana
 Bhava Bhaya Harana Vandhitha Charana
 Raghukula Bhushana Rajiva Lochana
 Adhi Narayana Anantha Sayana
 Satchidananda Shri Sathya Narayana
 
 Rama, the indweller of our hearts, is the embodiment of bliss.
 Narayana (Hari), who is eternal, removes the fear of existence.
 I bow at the feet of lotus-eyed Rama, the jewel of the Raghu dynasty.
 Lord Narayana, rests on Adhi Shesha. He is Sathya Narayana,
 the embodiment of truth, bliss and knowledge.

Ayodhya Ke Sita Ram Brindavan Ke Radhe Shyam
 Radhe Shyam Jaya Radhe Shyam
 Radha Madhava Radhe Shyam
 Sai Ram Jai Sai ram
 Partipurishvara Sai ram
 Shirdipurishvara Sai Ram
 
 Rama, Lord of Sita, resides in Ayodhya. Krishna, 
 Lord of Radha, in Brindavan. Worship Lord Sai
 of Puttaparthi and of Shirdi.

Ayodhyavasi Ram Hai Dvaraka Me Aye
 Dvarakavasi Shyam Hai Shirdi Me Aye
 Shirdi Sai Ram Hai Parti Satya Sai
 Bolo Ram Sai Ram Bolo Satya Sai Ram
 
 Lord of Ayodhya, Rama, incarnated in Dvaraka as Krishna, 
 as Sai in Shirdi and in Puttaparthi. Chant the name of Sai Ram.

Ayodhyavasi Ram Ram Ram Dasharatha Nandhana Ram
 Pathitha Pavana Janaki Jeevana Sita Mohana Ram
 Ayodhyavasi Ram Ram Ram Dasharatha Nandhana Ram
 Pathitha Pavana Janaki Jeevana Sita Mohana Ram
 
 Lord Rama, the resident of Ayodhya and the beloved son of King
 Dasharatha, is the savior of the fallen and the Lord of Janaki (Sita).

Ayyappa Sharaname Ayyappa Sharaname Ayyappa Sharaname 
 ... Swami Ayyappa Sharaname (2)
 Sabari Nayaka Shanthi Dhayaka Ayyappa Sharaname
 ... Swami Ayyappa Sharaname
 Parthi Nayaka Prashanti Dhayaka Ayyappa Sharaname
 ... Swami Ayyappa Sharaname
 
 Take refuge in Ayyappa, the Lord of Sabari mountain and of Puttaparthi,
 who bestows supreme peace.

Baba Ao Mere Kirtan Me
 Antaryami Darsha Dikhao
 Naiya Hamari Par Lagao 
 Baba Ao Mere Kirtan Me
 Antar Jyoti Jalao Swami
 Jivan Jyoti Tum Ho Sai
 
 Baba, O indwelling Lord, please come and grant 
 Your darshan when I sing your glory. Guide our 
 lives across this ocean of existence and awaken our inner divinity. 
 You are the light of our lives.

Baba Dil Me Base Raho
 Janam Janam Me Sath Raho
 Hath Na Chodo Anath Natha
 Sath Na Chodo Sai Prabho
 Charanö Me lelo Sai Prabho (Tere)
 
 Baba, please reside in my heart and be with me all my life.
 Please do not let go of my hand O Lord of the destitutes. 
 I surrender to thee, protect me O Lord Sai.

Bada Chitta Chor Manmohan
 Mira Chittachor Jaganmohan
 Ayodhya Ke Sita Ram Brindavan Ke Radhe Shyam
 Shirdi Ke Sai Baba Parti Ke Satya Sai
 
 You are the great "stealer of hearts", the enchanter
 of the mind, the one who stole Meera's heart.
 You are Rama in Ayodhya, Krishna in Brindavan, 
 Sai Baba of Shirdi and Sathya Sai of Parthi.

Bada Chitta Chora Brindavana Sanchara
 Gopala Gopala Hey Murali Gopala
 Bada Chitta Chora Brindavana Sanchara
 Govardhanoddhara Gopala Bala
 Gopi Manohara Radhe Gopala
 
 Gopala, You are the great "stealer of hearts",
 who walked the gardens of Brindavan. As the young
 cowherd boy with the enchanting flute, You lifted the
 Govardhana mountain (to protect the devotees),
 and captivated Radha and the Gopis.

Bala Gopala Sai Bala Gopala
 Devaki Nandana Gopala
 Bala Gopala Sai Bala Gopala
 Vasudeva Nandhana Gopala
 Yashodha Bala Gopala
 Nandha Gopala Anandha Gopala
 Sai Gopala Sathya Sai Gopala
 
 Chant the name of Lord Sai. He is none other than the child
 Gopala, son of Devaki and Vasudeva, and the ever blissful (foster)
 son of Yashoda and Nanda

Bansidhara Kanhaiya Ghana Shyama Sundara
 Giridhari Gopa Bala Brindavana Vihara 
 Bansidhara Kanhaiya Ghana Shyama Sundara
 Govinda Madhava Hare Madhusudhana Mukunda
 Radhe Gopala Radhe Gopala Radhe Gopala Radhe 
 
 Chant the name of the holder of the flute, the charming child who
 is as beautiful as the dark cloud. The holder of the mountain and
 the beloved child of the cowherds, Krishna, played in Brindavan.
 Govinda is Vishnu and the slayer of the demon Madhu.

Beda Par Karo Mere Sai
 Uddhar Karo Mere Baba
 Beda Par Karo Mere Sai
 Allah Ishwara Sai Baba
 Shirdi Baba Parthi Baba
 Raham Nazar Karo Sai Baba
 Daya Karo Sai Krupa Karo
 
 Lord Sai, please uplift me and help me cross the ocean of
 life and death. Shower Your mercy, grace and compassion
 on us, Sai (known also as Allah, Iswar, Shirdi Baba)

Bhagavan, Shri Satya Sai Baba Bhagavan, Kali Yuga Avatara Bhagavan...
 ...Divine Love Of My Heart, Come To Me
 Hey Ghana Shyam Hey Sai Ram Chant The Names Of The Lord
 Sai Hold Me In Love, Lift Me Above, Bring Me Home To Thee
 Bhagavan, Sai Ram, Come To Me My Lord
 Hey Sita Ram, Hey Radha Shyam, Chant The Names Of The Lord
 Swami Fill Me With Peace, Grant Me Release, Make Me One With Thee
 Bhagavan, Sai Ram, Be With Me My Lord

Bhagavan Sri Satya Sai
 Come and make my heart Your home
 Come and make my life Your life
 Come and make me Yours

Bhaja Govindam Bhaja Gopalam
 Paramanandam Shyama Bhajo
 Nityananda Brahmananda
 Satchidananda Shyama Bhajo
 Prema Svarupam Dina Dayalam
 Paramanandam Sai Bhajo
 
 Chant the names of Govinda, Gopala and Krishna and attain eternal bliss. 
 Krishna and Sai are love incarnates and personify truth, knowledge and bliss.
 They are protectors of the fallen and afflicted. 
 Singing their names gives endless and supreme happiness.

Bhajamana Govinda Gopala
 Govinda Gopala Gopala
 Bhajamana Govinda Gopala
 Govinda Bolo Hari Gopala Bolo (2)
 Govinda Gopala Gopala
 
 O Mind! Worship Govinda and Gopala (Lord Krishna).

Bhajamana Ramam Shri Ramam
 Sundara Shyamala Komala Ramam
 Bhajamana Ramam Shri Ramam
 Bharatha Lakshmana Pujita Ramam
 Maruti Sevita Manobhiramam
 Pankaja Lochana Pattabhi Ramam
 
 O Mind, chant the names of Lord Rama, the dark-hued, handsome
 and gentle Lord. He is the protector of His devotees, the One 
 worshipped by Bharatha, Lakshmana and Hanuman. 
 The lotus-eyed Lord Rama is the crowned King (of Ayodhya).

Bhajana Karo Manva Govinda Hare
 Govinda Murare Gopala Murare
 Bhajana Karo Manva Govinda Hare
 Mathura Natha He Giridhari
 Radha Madhava He Giridhari (2)
 
 Chant, O mind, the name of Lord Krishna, protector of devotees, destroyer of Mura.
 He is the Lord residing in Mathura who held up the mountain (to save the devotees).
 He is Krishna, the beloved Lord of Radha.

Bhajo Bhajo Ram Sathya Sai Ram
 Bhajo Bhajo Ram Sai Ghana Shyam
 Kaliyug Ke Avatar
 Jagadoddara Sai Bhagwan
 Patita Pavana Sai Ram
 
 Chant the names of Rama, the redeemer of the fallen,
 the dark-hued Krishna, and of Sathya Sai,
 the incarnation of the Kali age, the savior of the World.

Bhajo Bhajo Vitthala Panduranga Vitthala
 Pandhari Natha Panduranga Bhajo Mana Vitthala
 Bhajo Bhajo Vitthala Panduranga Vitthala
 Partishvara Sai Natha Vitthala
 Parameshvara Satya Sai Vitthala
 Rakhumai Vitthala Ranga Sai Vitthala
 
 Worship Lord Krishna by chanting His 
 many names: Panduranga, Vitthala, Lord of the 
 city of Pandhari, and The Lord of all, 
 Sathya Sai of Puttaparthi.

Bhajo Gana Nayaka Gajavadana
 Mangala Dayaka Shubha Charana
 Siddhi Vinayaka Shiva Nandana
 Ananda Dayaka Chitta Chandana
 Buddhi Pradayaka Jagavandana
 Mangala Dayaka Shubha Charana
 
 Worship the elephant-faced Lord Ganesha, the leader
 of divine forces, and son of Lord Shiva. He bestows 
 success, bliss, auspiciousness, and liberation. He is 
 revered by one and all.

Bhajo Ghana Shyam Bhajo Murali Gopala Bhajo
 Nanda Ke Lal Bhajo Radhe
 Bhajo Ghana Shyam Bhajo Murali Gopala Bhajo
 Giridhara Gopala Mathura Natha
 Kamala Nayana He Kaivalya Dhatha
 Nanda Ke Lal Bhajo Radhe
 
 Worship Krishna, the dark-hued Lord who plays the flute.
 The delight of Nanda and Radha, He is the Lord of Mathura
 who held the mountain up (to protect the devotees).
 The lotus-eyed Lord bestows liberation.

Bhajo Madhura Hari Nam Nirantara Bhajo Madhura Hari Nam
 Sarala Bhava Se Sai Bhajo
 Madhura Bhava Se Baba Bhajo
 Hari Hi Sukha Hai Hari Hi Shanti
 Hari Prashanti Nivasi Ram
 
 Chant ceaselessly the sweet name of Hari and 
 worship Sai with sweet simple thoughts.
 Hari who is Sai Ram resides in Prashanti Nilayam
 and provides comfort and peace.

Bhajo Manuva Bhajo Manuva Govinda Narayana
 Govinda Narayana Gopala Narayana
 Sai Gopala Narayana
 Bhajo Manuva Bhajo Manuva Govinda Narayana
 Ramaya Narayana
 Krishnaya Narayana
 Shri Sai Narayana
 Sai Gopala Narayana
 
 O mind, chant the different names of Lord Sai:
 Govinda, Narayana, Rama and Krishna.

Bhajo Radhe Govindha Bhajo Shyama Gopal
 Shyama Gopal Bhajo Murali Gopal
 Bhajo Radhe Govindha Bhajo Shyama Gopal
 Keshava Narahari Shyama Gopal
 Madhava Murahara Murali Gopal
 
 Repeat the names of Krishna: beloved of Radha, dark-haired flute
 player, beautiful Keshava, God in human form, and slayer of the
 demon Mura.

Bhajo Sita Ram Bhajo Radhe Shyam
 Govinda Gopala Sai Hare Nam
 Keshava Madhava Radha Vallabha
 Varada Narayana Nayanabhiram
 Govinda Gopala Sai Hare Nam
 
 Sing the glory of Sita Ram and Radhe Shyam (Krishna); 
 of Govinda, Gopala, Madhava, Keshava; of Narayana,
 bestower of wishes; of Rama, who is to behold.

Bhajore Bhai Sai Ram
 Parthipurisha Sai Ram
 Bhajore Bhai Sai Ram
 Dwarakamayi Sai Ram
 Sada Sukhadayi Sai Ram
 Shirdipurisha Sai Ram
 Puttaparthipurisha Sai Ram
 
 Worship Lord Sai Ram, Lord of Puttaparthi, and of Dwarakamayi
 (Lord of Shirdi). He always grants happiness to all.

Bhajore Bhajo Sai Hare Ram
 Govindha Gopala Sai Hare Ram
 Madhava Mohana Sai Hare Ram
 Bhajore Bhajo Sai Hare Ram
 Shri Madhusudhana Bhava Bhaya Bhanjana
 Hari Premanand Se Bolo Ram Hare Ram
 Govindha Gopala Sai Hare Ram
 Madhava Mohana Sai Hare Ram
 
 Let us sing to Sai who is Rama, Govindha and Gopala;
 to enchanting Lord Krishna, the destroyer of the demon Madhu.
 He removes the fear of birth and death.

Bhajore Manva Baba Nam
 Bhakta Janö Ke Bhagwan
 Bhajore Manva Baba Nam
 Prema Pradayaka Bhagwan
 Bhagavan Bhagavan
 Prema Pradayaka Bhagwan
 Partipurishwara Bhagwan
 
 O mind, chant Baba's name. 
 He is the Lord of His devotees and the Lord of Parthi. 
 He endows us with love and devotion.

Bhajore Manva Sadgurudeva
 Parama Krupalu Sai Mahadeva
 Nisa Din Dhyan Karü Maïn Tera
 Janam Janam Ka Mite Andhera
 Parabrahma Parameshvara Rupa
 Parabrahma Parameshvara Deva
 Parama Krupalu Sai Mahadeva
 
 O Mind chant the name of the ever-merciful true Guru Sai.
 Day and night I meditate upon your name, O Sai, 
 to destroy my ignorance during each and every birth.

Bhajore Sada Bhajo Ram Kr'shna Govinda
 Bhajo Hare Dina Bandhu Kr'shna Rama Govinda
 Bhajore Anatha Natha Sai Rama Govinda
 Bhajo Hare Dina Bandhu Kr'shna Rama Govinda
 
 Always chant the name of Rama, Krishna, Govinda, 
 and Sai Ram. He is the shelter for the meek and the 
 uplifter of the helpless.

Bhakta Vatsala Tero Nam Sai

 Uma Maheshvari Kalavati
 
 Glory to the Mother of the Universe, the Primal Energy,
 the destroyer of evil. O Mother of Ganesha and Subrahmanya (Kumara),
 O Mother with a dark complexion who promotes well-being,
 the bestower of boons, you are the consort of Lord Siva (Maheshvara).
 We pray to Thee.

Jagadhoddharini Maa
 Vishwa Vilasini Maa
 Sthira Sukha Dhayini Maa
 Durgathi Nashini Maa
 Parthipurishwari Parvathi Maa
 Bhava Bhaya Harini Bhairavi Maa
 Shambhavi Maa Gauri Maa
 Jaya Parameshwari Jaya Bhuvaneshwari Jaya Parthishwari Parvathi Maa
 
 Mother Goddess, who supports the Universe, provides unchanging
 and eternal comfort, destroys bad tendencies and fears
 of this worldly existence. Salutations to Mother Goddess of Parthi

Jagadishvari Daya Karo Ma
 Shiva Shankari Krupa Karo Ma
 Saishvari Raksha Karo Ma
 Partishwari Daya Karo Ma
 Shiva Shankari Krupa Karo Ma
 
 O Divine Mother of the Universe, have mercy on us. O Mother Sai, protect us,
 and grant us boons and favors.

Jagadoddharini Mata Durga Jagadoddharini Ma
 Jago Jago Ma Jago Jago Ma Jago Jago Ma Janani
 He Durga Devi Ranachandi Devi
 He Shiva Ramana Jago Ma (2)
 Jago Jagadoddharini Ma
 
 O universal mother Durga, please arise. O delight of Lord Shiva, Gauri Devi, 
 Ranachandi Devi, kindly wake up (a plea for the inner awakening of our atmic reality).

Jagame Sarvam Vishnu Mayam
 Sadguru Shri Satya Sai Mayam (2)
 Jagame Sarvam Vishnu Mayam
 Omkara Nada Mayam
 Om Shiva Shakthi Mayam
 Prema Mayam Sai Nama Mayam
 Pranavakara Brahma Mayam
 
 The entire creation and the universe is a suffusion of Lord Vishnu and the
 supreme teacher, Sathya Sai, of the sound of Om, of Lord Shiva and
 Mother Parvathi (Energy), of Love and the name of Sai

Jaganmathe Jagat Janani
 Jaya Jagadambe Devi Bhavani
 Jaganmathe Jagat Janani
 Devi Saraswathi Durga Lakshmi
 Mahishasura Samharini Matha
 
 Victory to Goddess Amba, the Mother of the Universe
 The Universal Mother, is Saraswathi (bestower of knowledge),
 and Durga (Remover of evils). Greetings to the destroyer
 of Mahishasura (representing evil)

Jagathoddharana Parti Viharana
 (Prabhu) Tum Ho Mangala Dham
 Jai Sai Ram, Jai Sai Ram
 Papa Vimochana Bhava Bhaya Bhanjana
 Sundara Nayanabhiram (2)
 (Prabhu) Tum Ho Mangala Dham
 Jai Sai Ram, Jai Sai Ram
 
 O Lord Sai, the uplifter of the Universe, residing in Parti,
 You are the bestower of all auspiciousness. You absolve all sins, 
 destroy the fear of samsara - You are the beautiful
 light of our eyes. Victory to our Lord Sai.

Jagath Palana Jagan Mohana
 Sundara Sai Gopalana
 Munijana Sevita Madhusudhana 
 Jagath Palana Jagan Mohana
 Keshava Govinda Janardana
 Shridhara Madhava Damodara
 Achyuta Ananta Narayana
 Sri Sai Krishna Narayana (2)
 
 O Lord, the protector of the Universe, the bewitcher of the Universe, 
 O beautiful Sai Gopala, the One who serves the Rishis, the One who 
 destroyed the demon Madhu, Keshava, Govinda, Janaardhana, Sridhara, 
 Madhava, Damodara, Achyutha, Anantha, Narayana, Sai Krishna 
 (different names for Lord Krishna).

Jago Jago Jago Shankara
 Jago Jago Saishvara
 Jago Jago Jago Shankara
 Halahaladhara He Paramesha
 He Tripurari Jaya Parthisha
 Gangadhara Shankara
 Shiva Gowrivara Shankara
 Hara Gangadhara Shankara
 Satya Saishvara Shankara
 
 Awake, O Lord Shankar, awake O Lord Sai, to confer auspiciousness on all.
 Salutations to the great Lord who drank the deadly poison and held it in His throat,
 who slew the demon Tripura and received the celestial river Ganga on his head.
 Victory to Shiva and to Lord Sai.

Jago Jago Maa Shankari Maa
 Shankari Maa Abhayankari Maa
 Jaya Jaya Bhavani Maa
 Jago Jago Maa Shankari Maa
 Matha Maheshwari Parvathi Maa
 Devi Dhaya Karo Shiva Ramana
 Janani Trilokha Palini Maa
 Jaya Jaya Bhavani Maa
 
 O auspicious Mother Parvathi (Amba), sustainer of three Worlds
 and destroyer of fear, please wake up. Victory to You, Mother Bhavani.
 (Wake up means to be aware of atmic reality latent in us).

Jai Hari Bol Jai Sita Ram Gopi Gopala Bhajo Radhe Shyam
 Hare Ram Ram Ram Ghana Shyam Shyam Shyam
 Shri Raghu Nandhana Shri Rama Dasharathe Jaya Raghu Rama
 Nandha Kishora Navanitha Chora Brindhavana Govindha Lala
 Hare Ram Ram Ram Ghana Shyam Shyam Shyam
 
 Chant the names of Rama, Lord of Sita, prince of King Dadharatha
 of Raghu dynasty; of Hari, Gopala, Radhey Shyam; and Lord Krishna
 of Brindhavan, son of Nandha, who stole butter from Gopis as a child.

Jai Jai Jai Gana Nayaka Jai Jai Vigna Vinashaka
 Jai Shubha Managala Dhayaka Vidya Buddhi Pradhayaka
 Gajavadana Gowri Nandana (2)
 Gangadhara Shiva Shambo Nandana
 
 Salutations to Ganesha who removes obstacles
 and bestows auspiciousness, intellect and knowledge;
 to the elephant-faced son of Gowri and Shiva

Jai Jai Jai Jai Ganapathi Deva
 Gajanana Gajanana
 Gajanana He Ganapathi Deva
 Jai Jai Jai Jai Ganapathi Deva
 Matha Parvathi Pitha Maha Deva (2)
 Gajanana Gajanana
 Gajanana He Ganapathi Deva
 
 Victory to Lord Ganapathi, (Lord Ganesha), the son of 
 Mother Parvathi and Lord Mahadeva.

Jai Jai Janani Sai Janani Ambe Bhavani Maa
 Jaya Maa Jaya Maa
 Sai Bhavani Maa(Sathya)
 Simha Vahini Trishula Dharini Ambe Bhavani Maa
 Jaya Jaya Janani Sai Janani Parthi Nivasini Maa
 Jaya Maa Jaya Maa
 Sai Bhavani Maa (Sathya)
 
 Glory to Mother Sai, Amba and Bhavani. Mother Amba
 holds a trident, and her vehicle is a lion.
 Sing in glory to Mother Sai.

Jai Jai Prabhu Giridhari Natavara Nandalala
 Natavara Nandalala Hey Giridhari Gopala
 He Giridhari Gopala He Giridhari Gopala He Giridhari Gopala
 
 Glory to the Lord who held up the mountain; Krishna, the great dancer, beloved
 son of Nanda; O cowherd boy who supported the mountain.

Jai Jai Ram Govindha Hari Hari (3)
 Janaki Ram Govindha Hari Hari (3)
 Sai Ram Govindha Hari Hari (3)
 
 Glory be to Lord Rama, beloved of Mother Janaki,
 Lord Govindha Hari - the stealer of our hearts
 and Lord Sai who resides in Parthi.

Jai Jai Ram Krishna Hari
 Jai Jai Ram Jai Jai Ram Krishna Hari
 Jai Jai Ram Krishna Hari
 Jai Jai Ram Sai Hari
 Jai Jai Ram Jai Jai Ram Krishna Hari
 
 Glory be to Lord Rama, Lord Krishna (Hari) and Lord Sai Ram.

Jai Sairam Jai Sairam
 Premavatara Sai Avatara
 Jai Sairam Jai Sairam
 Ramavatara Sai Raghu Rama
 Krishnavatara Sai Ghanashyama
 Yuga Avatara Sai Bhagavan
 Sarvavatara Satya Sai Rama
 
 Victory to Lord Sai Ram whose form is Love Incarnate. 
 Lord Sathya Sai, the incarnations is all incarnations, 
 is also Rama, Krishna and Shiva.

Janaki Jivana Rama Raghuvira
 Jaya Bhuvaneshwara Raghava Sundara
 Janaki Jivana Rama Raghuvira
 Ravi Kula Mandana Asura Nikhandana
 Parama Niranjana Rama (Sai)
 Jaya Bhuvaneshwara Raghava Sundara
 
 King Rama, Lord of the Universe, the jewel of Raghu (Solar)
 dynasty, and the Lord of Sita, is the destroyer of evils, and the
 remover of fear. Glory be to the ever pure Lord Rama.

Janani Janani Sathya Sai Shubha Janani 
 Jagat Karani Paripurani Saishwari Janani 
 Sathya Swaroopini Janani 
 Dharma Samvardhani Janani 
 Shantha Swaroopini Janani 
 Prema Pradhayini Janani 
 
 Mother Sai, embodiment of auspiciousness, 
 Mother of the Universe, all encompassing and 
 promoter of righteousness (dharma), is the personification 
 of truth and peace and bestower of love.

Janani Sai Devi Dayamayi
 Janani Ma Krupalini Ma
 Tum Ho Prema Svarupini Ma
 Daya Karo Satya Sai Ma
 Krupa Karo Satya Sai Ma
 Janani Prema Dayini Ma
 
 Lord Sai is the compassionate and merciful mother. 
 You are the embodiment of love. 
 Sai! Please shower us with your compassion and love.

Jaya Ganaraya Shri Ganaraya
 Jaya Ganaraya Shri Ganaraya Mangala Murthi Moraya
 Siddhi Vinayaka Mangala Dhatha
 Ashta Vinayaka Mangala Dhayaka Mangala Murthi Moraya
 Sindhura Vadhana Pankaja Charana
 Sindhura Vadhana Pankaja Ramana Ganapathi Bappa Moraya
 
 Worship at the lotus feet of the eight forms of the elephant-
 faced Lord Ganesha who grants wishes and bestows
 prosperity and well-being.

Jaya Gopala Jaya Gopala
 Jaya Sai Govindha Gopala
 Jaya Gopala Jaya Gopala
 Chinmayanandha Hey Sai Gopala
 Nithyanandha Rupa Sai Gopala
 Jaya Sai Govindha Gopala
 
 Glory to Gopala (the cowherd boy, Krishna), the mind
 pleasing embodiment of constant bliss, and to Lord Sai.

Jaya Guru Deva Prabhu Sai Deva
 Devadi Deva Pranamamyaham
 Shiva Shiva Shambho Kailasa Pate
 Partipurishvara Palaya Mam
 Devadi Deva Paranamamyaham
 
 Victory to Lord Sai, the God of Gods, to whom I bow. 
 O Lord Shiva, the Lord of Kailasha and of Parthi, please protect me.

Jaya Guru Jaya Guru Sai Ram
 Jagat Guru Sathya Sai Ram
 Jaya Guru Jaya Guru Sai Ram
 Brahma Vishnu Shiva Sai Ram
 Parabrahma Rupa Sai Ram
 Matha Pitha Guru Sai Ram
 Jagat Guru Sathya Sai Ram
 
 Hail to the Universal teacher, Sathya Sai Ram, the creator,
 maintainer and destroyer. He is the embodiment of divinity,
 and the Universal mother, father and teacher.

Jaya Guru Omkara Jaya Jaya Sadguru Omkara Om
 Brahma Vishnu Sada Shiva
 Hara Hara Hara Hara Mahadeva
 
 Glory to the Guru who is the embodiment of the sacres Om,
 the true guru Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva

Jaya Jagadeesha Hare Jaya Govindha Hare
 Nithyananda Brahmananda Jaya Gopala Hare
 Arunachala Shiva Om Trishuladhari Shivom
 Hari Narayana Om Sai Narayana Om
 Jaya Devi Bharathi Vidhya Dhayini Annapoorna Mata Om
 
 Glory to the Lord of the Universe, Lord Govindha, the eternally
 and perpetually blissful One. Chant the name of the Lord of Arunachala,
 Lord Shiva, holding the Trishula (trident). Salutations to Mother
 Goddess Bharathi (Saraswathi), who bestows strength and knowledge.

Jaya Jaya Girija Bala Gajanana 
 Jaya Shiva Shankara Parvati Nandana 
 Vigna Vinashaka Vijaya Gajanana 
 Sharavana Sevitha Sumukha Gajanana 
 Tava Pada Sharanam Sharanam Gajanana 
 
 Salutations to Lord Ganesha, son of Girija (Parvati) and Shiva, 
 destroyer of obstacles and bestower of success. 
 We take refuge at the feet of pleasant, elephant-faced Gajanana, 
 adored by Lord Subramanyam.

Jaya Jaya Jaya He Shri Guru Natha

 Sathya Svaroopa Shiva Guru Natha
 Antaryami Vishva Vidhata
 Mukti Pradata Sai Guru Natha 
 
 Glory to Divine Master, Lord Sai, who is the embodiment of truth. 
 He is the indweller, supporter of the Universe 
 and grantor of liberation.

Jaya Jaya Krishna Yadhunandana
 Jaya Jaya Brindavana Chandana 
 Jaya Jaya Krishna Yadhunandana
 Jaya Jaya Krishna Manamohana
 Jaya Jaya Sai Gopalana (2X) 
 
 Glory to Lord Krishna, Prince of Yadhu dynasty, 
 the enchanting Sai, Krishna, and
 Gopala, who showers bliss on residents of Brindavan.

Jaya Jaya Ram Jagadhabhi Ram 
 Dina Bandhu Sai Ram 
 Jai Jai Ram Jai Jai Ram Sai Ram 
 Dhanava Bhanjana Dhaya Maya 
 Dhaya Maya Kripa Maya 
 Alakha Niranjana Asura Nikhandana 
 Dina Bhandhu Sai Ram 
 Jai Jai Ram Jai Jai Ram Sai Ram 
 
 Salutations to Lord Rama who has enchanted the whole Universe, the firend of the downtrodden, 
 and destroyer of demons (demonic tendencies). He is ocean of mercy, imperceptible and faultless.

Jaya Jaya Rama Jaya Raghu Rama Dasharatha -
 Nandana Raja Rama
 Abhaya Pradayaka Ananda Dayaka
 Tribhuvana Mohana Sai Rama
 Danava Bhanjana Dinoddharana
 Prema Sagara Sai Rama
 
 Glory to the beloved son of King Dasharatha, Lord Rama
 He is the grantor of peace by destroying fear.
 O Ocean of Pure Love, Lord Sai Ram!
 You are loved by three worlds.
 You are the uplifter of the weak and miserable,
 and you are the destroyer of evil qualities.

Jaya Jaya Shankara Sambashiva
 Jaya Parthishwara Sai Shiva
 Jaya Jaya Shankara Sambashiva
 Vyagrambaradhara Vibhuthi Sundara
 Ganga Jatadhara Gauri Manohara
 Narthana Sundara Natana Manohara
 Parthipuri Paramesha Shiva
 
 Glory to Lord Shankara (Shiva), beautifully adorned with
 holy ash and tiger skin. The enchanting Lord of Gauri wears
 the Holy Ganges in His matted hair and is the graceful divine
 dancer. The Lord of Parthi is the embodiment of Lord Shiva.

Jaya Panduranga Prabho Vitthala
 Jagadhoddhara Hari Vitthala
 Panduranga Vitthala Pandari Natha Vitthala
 Sri Ramani Hr'dayantharanga
 Mangala Kara Karunantharanga
 Ashrita Dina Janavana Ranga
 Jagadhoddhara Hari Vitthala
 Panduranga Vitthala Pandari Natha Vitthala
 
 Salutations to Lord Panduranga, Hari and Vitthala, the savior of the entire world.
 Chant the names of Lord Panduranga and Vitthala, the Lord of Pandari,
 who is the bestower of auspiciousness, the enchanter of hearts
 and the supporter of those who are afflicted and miserable.

Jaya Parthisha Jaya Paramesha
 Jaya Gaurisha Jaya Gangadhara
 Jatadhara Jaya Sai Shankara
 Vijayi Bhava Tava Sharanam Dehi (2)
 Sharanam Dehi
 
 Victory to the Supreme Lord, our Lord in Parthi.
 Victory to the Lord of Mother Gauri, Victory to the one who has the
 river Ganga in His matted locks. O Lord may Your Mission be Victorious.
 We seek refuge, please grant us your protection.

Jaya Rama Raghu Rama
 Ranandhira Sukumara
 Jaya Rama Raghu Rama
 Raghupati Raghava Raja Rama
 Rajiva Lochana Rama Rama
 
 Salutations to the lotus-eyed, beautiful and 
 young hero of the war for righteousness,
 Lord Rama of the Raghu dynasty.

Jaya Shri Ganesha Vighna Nasha Gajanana
 Vidya Buddhi Sarva Siddhi Puranjana
 Jaya Heramba Shri Jagadamba Nandana
 Ekadanta Dayavanta Shubhanana
 Mangala Dayaka Shri Vinayaka Vandana
 
 Salutations to Lord Ganesha, the destroyer of obstacles and the grantor of intelligence and success. Worship the beloved, beautiful, auspicious Lord Vinayaka, who has one tusk, and is the son of the Mother of the Universe.

Jhulana Jhulaye Brija Bala
 Jhule Nandalala Jhule Sai Bala
 Jhulana Jhulaye Brija Bala
 Resham Ki Dori Sone Ki Palana
 Arati Utare Brija Bala
 Jhule Nandalala Jhule Sai Bala
 
 The children of Brija have built a swing for Nanada's son, 
 Krishna, who is also Sai. Yashoda rocks the child Krishna 
 in a swing made of gold with silk ropes and the children 
 of Brija offer arati to Him.

Jivan Tere Havale Prabhu Ise Pag Pag Tu Hi Samhale
 Pag Pag Tu Hi Samhalete Ho Pag Pag Tu Hi Samhale
 Bhava Sagar Me Jivan Naiya Dol Rahi He O Rakhvaiya
 Dol Rahi He O Rakhvaiya
 Tu Hi Par Lagade Prabhu Ise Pag Pag Tu Hi Samhale
 
 O Lord, I have surrendered the boat of my life to You. Kindly help
 me cross the ocean of life and death as my life is unsteady
 and shaky, take care of me at every step of my life.

Kalimala Bhanjana Kodanda Rama
 Karunantharanga Kaivalya Dhama
 Kalimala Bhanjana Kodanda Rama
 Maya Manusha Muni Jana Prema
 Madhura Manohara Mangala Nama
 Partipurisha Prabhu Paramatma
 Patita Pavana Pattabhi Rama
 
 Lord Rama carrying the Kodanda bow, is a repository of mercy, 
 who bestows liberation and destroys the impurities of the Kali age. 
 His illusory human form and His beautifully enchanting name was 
 worshipped by the sages. He is Lord Sai of Pathi, the eternal and pure Spirit, 
 the savior of the fallen, He who resides in Prashanti Nilayam.

Kalyana Krishna Kamaniya Krishna
 Kalinga Mardana Shri Krishna
 Govardhana Giridhari Murari Gopi Mana Sanchari
 Brindavan Ki Tulasi Mala
 Pithambara Dhari Murari
 
 Lord Krishna has a loving and enchanting form and confers
 auspiciousness. He annihilated the cobra, named Kalinga, and lifted
 up the mountain Govardhana. The destroyer of the demon Mura,
 who resides in Gopi's hearts and in Brindavan, wears a garland
 of Tulsi leaves and a yellow colored robe.

Kamala Nethra Saishwara
 Kaivalya Theja Sureshwara
 Kamala Nethra Saishwara
 Megha Shyama Ghana Gagana Sharira
 Shantha Brahma Maya Abhaya Kara (2)
 
 Lotus-eyed Lord Sai, the effulgent Lord of Gods,
 bestower of salvation, embodiment of peace
 and our supreme protector, pervades the whole Universe

Kandha Kumara Kadirvela
 Gauri Puthra Vadivela
 Karthikeya Karuna Sagara
 Dina Sharanya Vadivela
 Shri Sai Natha Vadivela
 
 O Lord Skandha, the youthful one, son of Mother Gauri,
 ocean of compassion, Lord Sai, You are refuge of
 the weak.

Karuna Sagara He Nandalala
 Murali Manohara Shyama Gopala
 Karuna Sagara He Nandalala
 Giridhara Nagara Sai Gopala
 Mira Ke Prabhu Shyama Gopala
 
 Prince of Nanda, an ocean of compassion and the mind-captivating 
 divine flute player, is Lord of Meera and resident of Giridhara Nagara (town).

Karuna Sagari Kathyayini
 Kadambari Sai Kaliyuga Palini
 Karuna Sagari Kathyayini
 Kalmasha Nashini Kamitartha Pradhayini
 Kanchana Varuni Kaivalya Dhayini
 Kamala Vasini Lakshmi Narayani
 Parthi Nivasini Sai Narayani
 
 Mother Goddess Sai, protector of the Kali age,
 removes sins, fulfills our wishes, and bestows wealth
 and liberation. The consort of Vishnu sits in a lotus
 flower and resides in Parthi.

Karuna Sindhu Dasharatha Nandana Partipurishvara Ram
 Prema Svarupa Prashanti Niketana Maruti Sevita Ram
 Ahalyodharaka Rajiva Lochana Partipurishvara Ram
 
 Lord of Parthi, son of Dasharatha, is the ocean of compassion 
 and the embodiment of love residing in Prashanti. He, who was 
 worshipped by Hanuman and was the savior of the devotee Ahalya,
 was the lotus-eyed Rama, who is our Lord Sai in Parthi.

Karunalavala He Nandalala
 Ravela Ravela Rave Gopala
 Brindavana Bala Hey Gopilola
 Manamohana Hey Shyama Gopala
 Madhusudhana Hey Sai Gopala
 Ravela Ravela Rave Gopala
 
 O compassionate son of Nanda, Gopala, young Krishna,
 residing in Brindavan, enchanter of Gopis,
 and destroyer of demon Madhu, Sai Gopala, please come.

Karunantaranga Kari Raja Varadha Kamalesha Shri Sai Rama
 Omkara Rama Prashanti Rama
 Parabrahma Sathya Sai Rama
 Kamalesha Shri Sai Rama
 
 O lotus-eyed Lord Sai, embodiment of compassion and bestower
 of blessings, You are the Rama of Prashanti, the Pranava (Om),
 the supreme being.

Kashaya Vesha Dharana
 Kaliyuga Avathara Radha Ramana
 Kashaya Vesha Dharana
 Shirdi Sai Shri Sathya Sai
 Dwarakamayi Narayana
 Chithravathi Tira Narayana Hare
 
 Orange robed incarnation of the Kali age, and the beloved
 of Radha, is Lord Sathya Sai residing near Chithravathi river.
 He is Vishnu, and also Shirdi Sai who lived in Dwarakamayi.

Kasturi Ranga Kaveri Ranga
 Shri Ranga Ranga Ranga (2)
 Kalyana Ranga Karunanta Ranga
 Shri Ranga Ranga Ranga (Ranga)
 Garuda Gamana Ranga Shesha Sayana Ranga
 Shri Ranga Ranga Ranga (Ranga)
 
 Lord Vishnu (Kasturi Ranga) who bestows good fortune is
 eternally merciful.He reclines on a serpent and uses the
 eagle as His conveyance.

Kaushalyatmaja Rama Charan
 Vaidehi Priya Rama Charan
 Maruti Sevita Rama Charan
 Bharatarchita Shri Rama Charan
 Ahalyodharaka Rama Charan
 Shanti Niketana Rama Charan
 Rama Charan Sada Bhajo
 
 Always worship the feet of Lord Rama, who was dear to Sita, served by Hanuman, worshipped by
 Bharata, and who liberated Ahalya; He is the abode of Peace.

Keshava Madhava Jaya Deva Madhusudhana
 Nethra Kamala Dala Athiva Manohara
 Antharyami Prabhu Parameshwara
 Maya Manusha Vesha Liladhara (2)
 Jaya Deva Madhusudhana
 
 Salutations to Lord Krishna with beautiful hair and eyes like
 the lotus petals. The exceedingly enchanting Lord is the indweller.
 He has taken on the illusory human form as part of the divine play.

Know That The Lord Is Sweetness Itself
 Everything Is A Sign Of His Grace
 He's The Nearest, He's The Dearest, Born In the World Now...
 ...As Sri Sathya Sai
 Hold On To Him As Close As You Can
 Knowing Him As An Intimate Friend

Krishna Kanhaiya Krishna Kanhaiya
 Natavara Nanda Kumara Kanhaiya
 Brindavana Ke Bansi Adhariya
 Radha Manohara Ras Rachaiya
 Giridhara Nagara Shyama Kanhaiya
 Shri Madhusudhana Sai Kanhaiya
 
 O Lord Krishna, You play the Divine flute in Brindavan.
 O son of Nanda, who captured the heart of Radha, You dance with Gopis.
 O dark-hued Krishna, who lifted the Govardana mountain 
 You are our beloved Sai Krishna too.

Krishna Krishna Govinda Krishna Gopala Bala Krishna
 Nanda Nandana Bhaktha Chandana Bala Lola Krishna
 Sundara Vadhana Saroja Nayana Radha Priya Krishna
 Yadhava Krishna Yashodha Krishna Sathya Sai Krishna
 
 Chant the many names of Krishna, Govinda, Gopala and Nanda's Son.
 He delights His devotees with His beautiful face and lotus-shaped eyes.,
 He is also dear to Radha and Yashoda.

Krishna Krishna Mukunda Janardhana
 Krishna Govinda Narayana Hare
 Achyutananda Govinda Madhava
 Satchidananda Narayana Hare
 
 Chant the names of the Lord: Krishna, Janardhana
 Govinda, Narayana, Achyuta, all of which represent
 truth, knowledge and bliss.

Krishna Krishna Yadhuvara Krishna
 Mura Hara Keshava Yadhava Madhava
 Krishna Krishna Yadhuvara Krishna
 Murali Manohara Shyama Murari
 Shyama Murari Sai Murari
 Mura Hara Keshava Yadhava Madhava
 
 O Krishna of the Yadhu dynasty,
 O destroyer of the demon Mura,
 One who plays the enchanting flute,
 O Murari of dark complexion,
 O beloved Sai Krishna 
 Who is Keshava and Madhava.

Krishna Madhava Madhava Krishna
 Krishna Madhava Sai Hare 
 Brindavana Sanchari Shyama Gopala
 Jaya Madhusudana Jaya Nandalala
 Jhulana Jhule Mere Sai Nandalala
 Krishna Madhava Sai Hare
 
 Chant the names of Lord Krishna, Madhava and Sai who moved about in Brindavana. Salutations to Lord Krishna, the son of Nanda and the destroyer of the demon Madhu. Swing in the swings of our hearts, Lord Sai.

Krishna Mukunda Govinda Giridhara
 Murali Mohana Narayana
 Parthi Purandara Narayana
 Hare Parthi Purandara Narayana
 Madhava Shri Hari Mandara Giridhari
 Govinda Murahari Narayana
 Parthi Purandara Narayana (2)
 
 Chant the names of Lord Krishna, Mukunda, Govinda, Narayana
 and Lord Purandhara of Parthi. He who carried the mountain
 is Narayana, who slew the demon Mura (in Krishna avatar)

Krishna Murari Bhava Bhaya Hari Hey Giridhari Gopal 
 Parthi Vihari Hridhaya Vihari Bhaktha Sakha Bhagwan 
 Hey Bhaktha Sakha Bhagwan Sai Bhaktha Sakha Bhagwan 
 
 Lord Krishna, the slayer of the demon Mura, 
 the destroyer of the fears of existence, 
 and the holder of the mountain is the friend and kinsman of devotees. 
 He resides in Parthi and in our hearts.

Krishna Rama Govindha Gokula Nandhana Gopala
 Rama Krishna Govindha Jaya Brindhavana Gopala
 Sai Krishna Govindha Parthi Pureeshwara Gopala
 Gopala Sai Gopala (2)
 Gopi Manohara Gokula Bala Sai Murari
 
 Different epithets of Lord Krishna are equated to Lord Sai.

Krishna Rama Govinda Narayana
 Keshava Madhava Hari Narayana 
 Krishna Rama Govinda Narayana
 Shri Venu Gopala Krishna (2)
 Madhava Madhusudana Narayana
 
 Chant the many names of the Lord: 
 Krishna, Rama, Govinda, Narayana, Keshava, Madhava, Hari,
 Venu Gopala and Madhusudana.

Lambodhara Hey Vighneshwara
 Shambhu Kumara Siddheshvara (Shiva)
 Lambodhara Hey Vighneshwara
 Ambika Tanaya Omkareshwara
 Heramba Sai Shirdishwara
 Heramba Sai Partishwara
 
 Pot-bellied Lord Ganesha, the remover of obstacles
 is the son of Shambhu who grants success.
 Son of Ambika(Parvati) and the embodiment of Om
 is the beautiful Sai, Lord of Shirdi and Parthi.

Lambodhara Shiva Gauri Suta 
 Ganadhipa Jaya Gajanana 
 Lambodhara Shiva Gauri Suta 
 Balachandra Jaya Gaja Karneshwara

 Shri Sathya Sai Swagatham
 
 Welcome, Lord Sai, master of the saints, holy Lord of Parthi,
 uplifter of the weak. Son of Mother Eshwaramma, personification
 of the Eternal, grants bliss and protects the Universe.

Yuga Yuga Ke Avatara Tumhi Ho
 Mere Ram Mere Shyam Shirdi Sai Parti Ram
 Jaga Ke Palana Hara Tumhi Ho
 Allah Ishvara Tere Nam
 Tere Nam, Tere Nam
 Allah Ishvara Tere Nam Shirdi Sai Parti Ram 
 Jaga Ke Palana Hara Tumhi Ho
 
 Lord of Shirdi and Parthi are the same as Rama and 
 Krishna. The Lord has incarnated in every age and is
 the Sustainer of entire creation. He is Allah and Ishvar. 
 Lord Sai Ram, please grant intelligence and 
 equal-mindedness to all.
